page.title: 08Types of houses and farms
page.content: Lots of houses in our survey area are made of stone and are very old.Some of the cottages have thatched roofs.There are no new estates.Most of the new houses are detached bungalows because old people often retire and come to live in Cornwall.Some houses are let in the summer to people on holiday.There are several farmhouses in the area because much of the land is farmland. Most of the farms are mainly dairy.There is a little farm that has pigs and poultry and another that does a bit of horticulture.A few farms have mixed crops.There is no Grade 1 land and a tiny bit of Grade 2 and 3 and a lot of Grade 4 and 5 which is poorer grassland and rough grazing and some ungraded land.The farmer on Predannack is trying to clear stones from some of the rough land.
